title: Upload a File to DataStore
text: attempting upload file DataStore reference, conditions need met. Make sure edit permissions DataStore reference. Make sure reference permits uploads. Certain types reference, programs projects, designed containers organizing references therefore directly contain files. Make sure internal NPS network.

title: Upload a File to DataStore
text: Consider using testing version DataStore [https://irmadev.nps.gov/DataStore] make sure code works expected uploading real DataStore. especially good idea iterating large number files.

title: Upload a File to DataStore
Upload a File to DataStore
text: ’ll need following information: location file hard drive. Make sure path includes name file (just folder lives ), sure slashes path either single forward slashes (/) double backslashes (\). reference ID DataStore reference uploading . navigate reference web browser, URL look something like : “https://irma.nps.gov/DataStore/Reference/Profile/1234567”. number end URL (example, 1234567) reference ID. Whether file 508-compliant. Set information using code template : Double-check reference ID! ’s incorrect, file upload either fail, file end wrong reference. Double-check file path! Make sure ’s correct, make sure aren’t uploading sensitive data public reference. certain everything correct, perform file upload: upload_file_to_reference return list containing direct download URL file, well file ID DataStore uses uniquely identify file.
code: file_to_upload <- "C:/your/file/location/here.csv" reference_id <- 1234567  # Replace this with your reference ID dev <- TRUE  # Change this to FALSE when you are done testing is_508_compliant <- FALSE  # If you know your file is 508 compliant, change to TRUE interactive <- TRUE  # If TRUE, you will be prompted to confirm file upload uploaded_file_info <- upload_file_to_reference(reference_id = reference_id,                                                file_path = file_to_upload,                                                 is_508 = is_508_compliant,                                                interactive = interactive,                                                dev = dev)

title: Upload a File to DataStore
text: need upload many files reference, just need generate vector file paths can iterate . Next, use lapply upload file:
code: my_folder <- "scratchpad"  # The folder containing the files you want to upload pattern <- "\\.csv$"  # Look for files ending in ".csv" my_files <- list.files(my_folder, pattern = pattern, ignore.case = TRUE, full.names = TRUE) interactive <- FALSE  # Turn off the interactive confirmation prompt dev <- TRUE  # It's definitely good to test this out on irmadev first reference_id <- 1234567  # Replace this with your reference ID  # Iterate through each file and upload it all_file_info <- lapply(my_files, function(file) {   file_info <- upload_file_to_reference(reference_id = reference_id,                                         file_path = file,                                          is_508 = is_508_compliant,                                         interactive = interactive,                                         dev = dev)   return(tibble::tibble(original_file = file,                         url = file_info$url,                         file_id = file_info$file_id)) })  # Collapse uploaded file info into a single dataframe all_file_info <- dplyr::bind_rows(all_file_info)

text: Sarah E. Wright. Author, maintainer.

code: @Manual{,   title = {NPSdatastore: R Interface for the National Park Service DataStore API},   author = {Sarah E. Wright},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9003, https://github.com/nationalparkservice/NPSdatastore},   url = {https://nationalparkservice.github.io/NPSdatastore/}, }

what: R Interface for the National Park Service DataStore API
title: R Interface for the National Park Service DataStore API
text: NPS DataStore official home National Park Service (NPS) datasets, publications, . Use package search contents DataStore, download files, publish new content (write access authorized NPS users ). NPS DataStore organized references, may contain digital files, URLs external resources, information locate physical resources easily digitized (e.g. museum item, herbarium samples). Every reference also contains metadata, description contents information author(s). two special types references, called Programs Projects, contain references. references belong Program Project, helpful way organize things. Project references contain references related - guessed - single project. example Project might “Amphibian Inventory Great Smoky Mountains National Park,” might contain reference final dataset resulting inventory, another reference protocol used conduct inventory, yet another reference published report summarizing inventory results. reference can belong multiple Project references. Program references contain multiple Project references, typically represent group working similar related projects. “Great Smoky Mountains National Park Resource Management Team” example Program might contain example Project described .

title: R Interface for the National Park Service DataStore API
text: can install development version NPSdatastore GitHub :

what: Search for references by their ID
title: R Interface for the National Park Service DataStore API
text: Every reference DataStore unique identifer, known reference ID. DataStore web application, IDs can found end reference URL, next Reference Type, “Code” column tabular list references: know reference IDs references interested , can use search_references_by_id() retrieve detailed information . returns nested list whose names reference IDs. search_references_by_id() isn’t able locate references, throw warning. isn’t able locate references, throw error. ’s overkill, can get just basic information single tibble:
code: library(NPSdatastore) reference_ids <- c(2308561,  # This is a Program reference                    2171447,  # This is a Project reference                    2309935)  # This is a reference with files and external links reference_info <- search_references_by_id(reference_ids) str(head(reference_info, 2), max.level = 2) #> List of 2 #>  $ 2171447:List of 25 #>   ..$ referenceId         : int 2171447 #>   ..$ referenceType       : chr "Project" #>   ..$ citation            : chr "Stephanie O'Meara, Colorado State University and Others. Geologic Resources Inventory Project for Yellowstone N"| __truncated__ #>   ..$ visibility          : chr "Public" #>   ..$ lifecycle           : chr "Active" #>   ..$ newVersion          : NULL #>   ..$ masterId            : NULL #>   ..$ bibliography        :List of 21 #>   ..$ parent              : NULL #>   ..$ series              : NULL #>   ..$ filesAndLinks       : NULL #>   ..$ children            : NULL #>   ..$ products            :List of 41 #>   ..$ projects            : NULL #>   ..$ crossReferences     : NULL #>   ..$ units               : tibble [3 × 3] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>   ..$ boundingBoxes       : NULL #>   ..$ taxa                : NULL #>   ..$ subjects            : NULL #>   ..$ keywords            : chr [1:24] "geologic features" "Geologic Features and Processes" "Geologic History" "Geologic Issues" ... #>   ..$ permissions         :List of 8 #>   ..$ history             :List of 5 #>   ..$ versions            : NULL #>   ..$ contentProducerUnits: tibble [1 × 2] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>   ..$ programs            :List of 1 #>  $ 2308561:List of 25 #>   ..$ referenceId         : int 2308561 #>   ..$ referenceType       : chr "Program" #>   ..$ citation            : chr "Inventory and Monitoring Division, Central Support Office.  " #>   ..$ visibility          : chr "Public" #>   ..$ lifecycle           : chr "Active" #>   ..$ newVersion          : NULL #>   ..$ masterId            : NULL #>   ..$ bibliography        :List of 21 #>   ..$ parent              : NULL #>   ..$ series              : NULL #>   ..$ filesAndLinks       : NULL #>   ..$ children            :List of 15 #>   ..$ products            : NULL #>   ..$ projects            : NULL #>   ..$ crossReferences     : NULL #>   ..$ units               : NULL #>   ..$ boundingBoxes       : NULL #>   ..$ taxa                : NULL #>   ..$ subjects            : NULL #>   ..$ keywords            : NULL #>   ..$ permissions         :List of 8 #>   ..$ history             :List of 5 #>   ..$ versions            : NULL #>   ..$ contentProducerUnits: tibble [1 × 2] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>   ..$ programs            : NULL reference_info_basic <- search_references_by_id_basic(reference_ids) str(reference_info_basic, strict.width = "cut") #> tibble [3 × 18] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ referenceId               : int [1:3] 2171447 2308561 2309935 #>  $ referenceType             : chr [1:3] "Project" "Program" "Geospatial Data".. #>  $ dateOfIssue               : chr [1:3] "2007-09-17T12:00:00Z" "1998-01-01T1".. #>  $ lifecycle                 : chr [1:3] "Active" "Active" "Active" #>  $ visibility                : chr [1:3] "Public" "Public" "Public" #>  $ fileCount                 : int [1:3] 0 0 4 #>  $ fileAccess                : chr [1:3] "Internal" "Public" "Public" #>  $ title                     : chr [1:3] "Geologic Resources Inventory Projec".. #>  $ citation                  : chr [1:3] "Stephanie O'Meara, Colorado State U".. #>  $ allContactsDisplayCitation: chr [1:3] "Stephanie O'Meara, Colorado State U".. #>  $ referenceUrl              : chr [1:3] " https://irma.nps.gov/DataStore/Ref".. #>  $ contacts                  : logi [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ referenceGroupType        : chr [1:3] "Organizational" "Organizational" "D".. #>  $ typeName                  : chr [1:3] "Project" "Program" "Geospatial Data".. #>  $ isDOI                     : chr [1:3] "False" "False" "False" #>  $ newVersion                : logi [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ mostRecentVersion         : logi [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ productCount              : int [1:3] 0 0 0 #>  - attr(*, ".internal.selfref")=<externalptr>

title: Add external links to a DataStore reference — add_external_link
text: reference_id Numeric reference ID. must appropriate permissions edit reference. url full URL wish add external link. Web URLs must start "https://". description description external link. last_verified Character. date ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2025-07-21") URL last verified correct working. can almost always allow default current date. dev Logical. Defaults TRUE best attempt modify references development & testing version DataStore first. everything working, change dev = FALSE run edit real reference. interactive Logical. Prompt user confirmation uploading?

text: list information link added

what: Create a new draft reference — create_draft_reference
title: Create a new draft reference — create_draft_reference
text: Create new draft reference

title: Create a new draft reference — create_draft_reference
code: create_draft_reference(   title,   reference_type_code,   date_published,   date_precision_code,   dev = TRUE )

title: Create a new draft reference — create_draft_reference
text: title title reference reference_type_code code indicating type reference. See get_reference_types() full list valid reference types. date_published Text string date publication. MUST "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM", "YYYY" format. Often current date, may earlier resource previously published outside DataStore (often case journal articles, newsletters, etc.). date_precision_code Optional. date_published specifies year, may optionally use specify season quarter. See get_date_precision() valid options. dev Logical. Defaults TRUE best attempt modify references development & testing version DataStore first. everything working, change dev = FALSE run edit real reference.

title: Create a new draft reference — create_draft_reference
text: list containing information uploaded reference, including reference profile URL reference ID.

title: Create a new draft reference — create_draft_reference
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   new_ref <- create_draft_reference(title = "2024 Oakridge Goose Inventory",                                     reference_type_code = "Datapackage",                                     date_published = "2025-02-14",                                     dev = TRUE)    another_new_ref <- create_draft_reference(title = "Oakridge Wildlife Hazards Update: Spring 2025",                                             reference_type_code = "NewsletterArticle",                                             date_published = "2025",                                             date_precision_code = "Spring",                                             dev = TRUE) } # }

title: Sets the
text: reference_id Integer. Typically seven-digit code life_cycle String. Defaults "Status Quo". Acceptable alternatives "Active" "Draft". nps_internal Logical. Defaults TRUE. Must TRUE write actions. dev Logical. Target development server? Defaults TRUE. False target production server. by_for_NPS Logical. Defaults TRUE

text: dataframe

title: Sets the
text: function includes relatively little error checking gives opportunity user input started. idea user done vetting prior using function. instance, reference activated reason, function end error. Common errors include: supplying wrong reference id number, connected VPN NPS network, correct permissions make changes reference (e.g. owner reference) , attempting activate reference supplied information necessary activate reference (perhaps files attached perhaps specified authors). function returns dataframe reference id, current (running function) status "NPS", initial final lifecycle status reference, hyperlink reference profile.

title: Upload file to an existing DataStore reference — upload_file_to_reference
text: function available NPS users internal network. hood, files broken multiple chunks uploaded one chunk time. decreases likelihood failure large files slow networks.

title: Upload file to an existing DataStore reference — upload_file_to_reference
code: upload_file_to_reference(   reference_id,   file_path,   is_508 = FALSE,   description,   dev = TRUE,   interactive = TRUE,   chunk_size_mb = 1,   retry = 1 )

title: Upload file to an existing DataStore reference — upload_file_to_reference
text: reference_id Numeric reference ID. must appropriate permissions edit reference. file_path path file want upload. is_508 file 508 compliant? description short description file dev Logical. Defaults TRUE best attempt modify references development & testing version DataStore first. everything working, change dev = FALSE run edit real reference. interactive Logical. Prompt user confirmation uploading? chunk_size_mb "chunk" size break file upload. network slow uploads failing, try decreasing number (e.g. 0.5 0.25). retry many times retry uploading file chunk fails first try.

title: Upload file to an existing DataStore reference — upload_file_to_reference
text: tibble containing information uploaded file.

title: Upload file to an existing DataStore reference — upload_file_to_reference
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ id <- 12345  # The ID of a reference you have edit permissions to upload <- upload_file_to_reference(reference_id = id,                                    file_path = here::here("data", "my_file.csv"),                                    is_508 = TRUE,                                    dev = TRUE,                                    interactive = TRUE,                                    chunk_size_mb = 1) } # }
